abstract: Kevin C Fitzpatrick, who runs 3,000-member Dorothy Parker Society, is championing the preservation of 1890s limestone row house at 214 West 72nd Street in Manhattan, where Parker, famed satirist, essayist and critic, lived until she was about 5 years old; wants the local community board to recommend to the Landmarks Preservation Commission that the building be included in proposed West End Avenue historic district.
snippet: A Dorothy Parker aficionado wants one of her childhood homes preserved, while its owner wants to replace it with a 12-story apartment building.
lead_paragraph: A Dorothy Parker aficionado wants one of her childhood homes preserved, while its owner wants to replace it with a 12-story apartment building.

headline.main: To Fan Fearing Wrecking Ball, the City Is Dorothy Parker’s
headline.print_headline: To Fan Fearing Wrecking Ball, The City Is Dorothy Parker’s
headline.seo: The Dorothy Parker Mystique vs. an Apartment Building
